 32namespace vsip
 33{
 34namespace impl
 35{
 36namespace fft
 37{
 38
 39/// evaluator template.
 40/// This needs to be provided for each tag in the LibraryTagList.
 41template <dimension_type D,
 42	  typename I,
 43	  typename O,
 44	  int sD,
 45	  vsip::return_mechanism_type rmT,
 46	  unsigned nT,
 47	  typename Tag>
 48struct evaluator
 49{
 50  static bool const ct_valid = false;
 51};
 52
 53template <dimension_type D,
 54	  typename I,
 55	  typename O,
 56	  int S,
 57	  return_mechanism_type R,
 58	  unsigned N,
 59	  typename TagList,
 60	  typename Tag = typename TagList::first,
 61	  typename Rest = typename TagList::rest,
 62	  typename Eval = evaluator<D, I, O, S, R, N, Tag>,
 63	  bool CtValid = Eval::ct_valid>
 64struct factory;
 65
 66/// In case the compile-time check passes, we decide at run-time whether
 67/// or not to use this backend.
 68template <dimension_type D,
 69	  typename I,
 70	  typename O,
 71	  int S,
 72	  return_mechanism_type R,
 73	  unsigned N,
 74	  typename TagList,
 75	  typename Tag,
 76	  typename Rest,
 77	  typename Eval>
 78struct factory<D, I, O, S, R, N, TagList, Tag, Rest, Eval, true>
 79{
 80  typedef backend<D, I, O,
 81		  axis<I, O, S>::value,
 82		  exponent<I, O, S>::value> interface;
 83  static std::auto_ptr<interface> 
 84  create(vsip::Domain<D> const& dom, typename interface::scalar_type scale)
 85  {
 86    if (Eval::rt_valid(dom)) return Eval::create(dom, scale);
 87    else return factory<D, I, O, S, R, N, Rest>::create(dom, scale);
 88  }
 89};
 90
 91/// In case the compile-time check fails, we continue the search
 92/// directly at the next entry in the type list.
 93template <dimension_type D,
 94	  typename I,
 95	  typename O,
 96	  int S,
 97	  return_mechanism_type R,
 98	  unsigned N,
 99	  typename TagList,
100	  typename Tag,
101	  typename Rest,
102	  typename Eval>
103struct factory<D, I, O, S, R, N, TagList, Tag, Rest, Eval, false>
104  : factory<D, I, O, S, R, N, Rest>
105{};
106
107/// Terminator. Instead of passing on to the next element
108/// it aborts the program. It is a program error to define
109/// callback lists that can't handle a given expression.
110template <dimension_type D,
111	  typename I,
112	  typename O,
113	  int S,
114	  return_mechanism_type R,
115	  unsigned N,
116	  typename TagList,
117	  typename Tag,
118	  typename Eval>
119struct factory<D, I, O, S, R, N, TagList, Tag, None_type, Eval, true>
120{
121  typedef backend<D, I, O,
122		  axis<I, O, S>::value,
123		  exponent<I, O, S>::value> interface;
124  static std::auto_ptr<interface> 
125  create(Domain<D> const &dom, typename interface::scalar_type scale)
126  {
127    if (Eval::rt_valid(dom)) return Eval::create(dom, scale);
128#if VSIP_IMPL_VERBOSE_FFT_EXCEPTION
129    std::ostringstream msg;
130    msg << "Requested Fft "
131	<< "(dim: " << D << "  size: " << dom[0].size();
132    for (index_type i=1; i<D; ++i)
133      msg << "," << dom[i].size();
134    msg << ") not supported by available backends";
135    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(std::runtime_error(msg.str()));
136#else
137    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(std::runtime_error(
138		      "Requested Fft not supported by available backends"));
139#endif
140    return std::auto_ptr<interface>();
141  }
142};
143
144} // namespace vsip::impl::fft
145
146namespace fftm
147{
148
149/// evaluator template.
150/// This needs to be provided for each tag in the LibraryTagList.
151template <typename I,
152	  typename O,
153	  int A,
154	  int E,
155	  vsip::return_mechanism_type R,
156	  unsigned N,
157	  typename Tag>
158struct evaluator
159{
160  static bool const ct_valid = false;
161};
162
163template <typename I,
164	  typename O,
165	  int A,
166	  int E,
167	  vsip::return_mechanism_type R,
168	  unsigned N,
169	  typename TagList,
170	  typename Tag = typename TagList::first,
171	  typename Rest = typename TagList::rest,
172	  typename Eval = evaluator<I, O, A, E, R, N, Tag>,
173	  bool CtValid = Eval::ct_valid>
174struct factory;
175
176/// In case the compile-time check passes, we decide at run-time whether
177/// or not to use this backend.
178template <typename I,
179	  typename O,
180	  int A,
181	  int E,
182	  vsip::return_mechanism_type R,
183	  unsigned N,
184	  typename TagList,
185	  typename Tag,
186	  typename Rest,
187	  typename Eval>
188struct factory<I, O, A, E, R, N, TagList, Tag, Rest, Eval, true>
189{
190  typedef fft::fftm<I, O, A, E> interface;
191  static std::auto_ptr<interface> 
192  create(vsip::Domain<2> const& dom, typename interface::scalar_type scale)
193  {
194    if (Eval::rt_valid(dom)) return Eval::create(dom, scale);
195    else return factory<I, O, A, E, R, N, Rest>::create(dom, scale);
196  }
197};
198
199/// In case the compile-time check fails, we continue the search
200/// directly at the next entry in the type list.
201template <typename I,
202	  typename O,
203	  int A,
204	  int E,
205	  vsip::return_mechanism_type R,
206	  unsigned N,
207	  typename TagList,
208	  typename Tag,
209	  typename Rest,
210	  typename Eval>
211struct factory<I, O, A, E, R, N, TagList, Tag, Rest, Eval, false>
212  : factory<I, O, A, E, R, N, Rest>
213{};
214
215/// Terminator. Instead of passing on to the next element
216/// it aborts the program. It is a program error to define
217/// callback lists that can't handle a given expression.
218template <typename I,
219	  typename O,
220	  int A,
221	  int E,
222	  vsip::return_mechanism_type R,
223	  unsigned N,
224	  typename TagList,
225	  typename Tag,
226	  typename Eval>
227struct factory<I, O, A, E, R, N, TagList, Tag, None_type, Eval, true>
228{
229  typedef fft::fftm<I, O, A, E> interface;
230  static std::auto_ptr<interface> 
231  create(Domain<2> const &dom, typename interface::scalar_type scale)
232  {
233    if (Eval::rt_valid(dom)) return Eval::create(dom, scale);
234#if VSIP_IMPL_VERBOSE_FFT_EXCEPTION
235    std::ostringstream msg;
236    msg << "Requested Fftm "
237	<< "(size: " << dom[0].size() << "," << dom[1].size() 
238	<< ") not supported by available backends";
239    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(std::runtime_error(msg.str()));
240#else
241    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(std::runtime_error(
242		      "Requested Fftm not supported by available backends"));
243#endif
244    return std::auto_ptr<interface>();
245  }
246};
